headline: Ongoing doctors’ strike is one too many
summarized_story:
Like Nigerian lecturers, doctors have used the strike option too frequently and without considering the plight of patients, who are often the most vulnerable.
However, doctors, as the apex medical professionals, should employ the strike option only as a last resort.
Students suffer when universities are grounded by striking lecturers, the economy is harmed when oil sector workers down tools, and commuters are stranded when transport unions strike.
As their colleagues do elsewhere, Nigerian doctors should adopt a strategy whereby some members will down tools while others continue working.
When in April 2016, junior doctors in the UK went on strike over new working contracts, it was only for two days.

headline: Insecurity caused by failure to utilise solid mineral sector – Masari
summarized_story:
Governor Aminu Bello Masari of Katsina State has attributed the persistent spate of insecurity bedeviling most parts of the country to the failure to fully exploit the solid mineral resources with which the nation is abundantly blessed.
Governor Masari made the remarks on Monday when he paid a courtesy visit to the Minister of Mines and Steel Development, Architect Olamilekan Adegbite in Abuja.
The Governor also asserted that the agitations for resource control and restructuring would be out of fashion when the nation’s other resources, such as solid minerals, are fully exploited and harnessed.
According to the Katsina State Governor, every state in the nation was sufficiently endowed with one mineral resource or the other, which if fully utilised, there would be sufficient engagement for the youth to render criminal activities unnecessary.
Similarly, he expressed the belief that “agitation for resource development and restructuring will all away go away with the development of the various mineral resources each state is endowed with”.

headline: Ministry of Foreign Affairs reacts to video of Nigerian diplomat being beaten in Indonesia
summarized_story:

“The Nigerian Government has complained strongly to the Government of Indonesia and the Ambassador of Indonesia to Nigeria was summoned by the Nigerian Minister of Foreign Affairs.

headline: Human Trafficking: INTERPOL Arrests Nigerian, 286 Others
summarized_story:

The INTERPOL stated this on its official website, where it also explained that the Nigerian suspect, whose name was not given, was nabbed when its agents conducted a check on a passenger manifest during an operation tagged, ‘Smuggling Training and Operations Programme, (Operation STOP)’.
Operation STOP included training provided to 20 frontline officers to optimise the use of Interpol’s policing capabilities, including its criminal and stolen and lost travel documents databases, to better track the movement of criminals and identify potential victims.
ADVERTISEMENTThe INTERPOL statement also said: “The hit on the Spanish Red Notice was generated by checking names and passports against Interpol’s databases using I-Batch, an application that processes bulk data from passenger manifests in a very short time.”Ghana’s Commissioner of Police, Isaac Yeboah, was quoted as stating that the training and the operational use of INTERPOL’s databases was crucial to enhance the capacity of all officers, build a great network and exchange information quickly and effectively.

headline: PDP Governors’ Six-Hour Meeting Over Embattled Chairman, Secondus Ends In Deadlock
summarized_story:

Addressing newsmen at the end of the meeting, Sokoto state governor and chairman of the PDP Governors’ Forum, Aminu Tambuwal, expressed the readiness of the governors to continue the meeting until the Secondus’ issue was resolved, Vanguard reports.

headline: Nigerian Govt Condemns Assault On Diplomat By Indonesian Officials

“The unfortunate incident is against international law and the Vienna Conventions governing Diplomatic and Consular Relations between states,” the Nigerian Foreign Affairs Ministry said in a statement on Monday.

headline: Indonesia apologises to Nigeria over manhandling of Nigerian Dilpomat in Jakarta
summarized_story:
The Federal Government of Nigeria through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has protested strongly to the government of Indonesia over the arrest and maltreatment of a Nigerian diplomat in front of his apartment in the Indonesian capital of Jakarta.
The Government in Statement issued from the ministry of Foreign Affairs described the incident where the diplomat was manhandled as unacceptable, against International Law and a contravention of the Vienna convention governing diplomatic and Consular relations between States.
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs said it has invited the Indonesian Ambassador to Nigeria who has apologised unreservedly to the Federal Government on behalf of the Indonesian government while also explaining what went wrong.
The Immigration officials concerned have also been to the Nigerian embassy to apologise to the Nigerian ambassador to Indonesia and the concerned diplomat according to the Nigerian ambassador to Indonesia.

headline: EFCC grills NIPC Boss, Yewande Sadiku, over alleged abuse of office
summarized_story:
The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission(EFCC) has grilled the Executive Secretary and Chief Executive Officer of the Nigerian Investment Promotion Council (NIPC) Mrs. Yewande Sadiku for about nine hours.
According to a source at the commission, the NIPC boss volunteered statement to a team of operatives.
But it was unclear if the NIPC boss will be detained or not as at press time.
AdvertisementThe source said: “NIPC CEO, Mrs. Yewande Sadiku is currently in the custody of the, EFCC.
“The NIPC boss is being questioned for abuse of office, bordering largely on issues over contract running into several millions of Naira and a posse of unearned frivolous allowances.

headline: Two Naval men die in gun duel in Anambra
summarized_story:
Two men of the Nigerian Navy have been feared killed during a gun duel with suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) in Anambra State.
As at the time of filing this report, the gun shots were still booming in the area with residents scampering to safetyIt was the same spot where three Naval men were killed in a gun duel with gunmen last year.
The gunmen were reported to have stormed the area in five vehicles where the security operatives were stationed and opened fire.
AdvertisementAnambra police spokesman, Ikenga Tochukwu, however said he had not received detailed reports on the incident but confirmed there was heavy shooting in the area.
He added that security operatives were being deployed to the area to restore normalcy.

headline: Nigeria: APC Secretary Explains Heavy Security Presence at Party Secretariat
summarized_story:
“The police are here to strengthen the security for the leadership of the Governor Mai Mala Buni-led APC CECPC.
“Whenever you have a security situation or report, you take precautions to protect lives and property.
Akpanudoedehe said the APC could not underestimate the security report and could not play down on it.
The APC secretary said it was the responsibility of the CECPC as managers of the party to put measures in place to protect lives and property.
He, however, advised that no one should take anything for granted, saying that every security report must be taken seriously.

headline: Lagos Marriot Appoints Van Rensburg as General Manager
summarized_story:
The Lagos Marriott Hotel Ikeja has announced the appointment of Rudi Janse Van Rensburg as General Manager.
Van Rensburg arrives with a vast wealth of 19 years’ experience in the hospitality sector, 13 of those years spent as General Manager across hotels and resorts in Africa.
Rudi will lead the management & operations of the Lagos Marriott Hotel, Ikeja.
Van Rensburg has accomplished great things during his time in Nigeria and was named General Manager of the Year in 2009.
The General Manager is passionate and focused on impeccable 5-Star sophistication, very committed to his associates and identifies whole heartedly with the African continent.

headline: Zuma’s Corruption Trial on Tuesday ‘to Be Postponed’ Due to Ill Healfh
summarized_story:
The Jacob Zuma Foundation says Tuesday’s planned hearing relating to the corruption trial of former South African President Jacob Zuma is set to be postponed.
Zuma – who is currently serving a sentence for contempt of court – was expected to appear Tuesday for a court session relating to charges concerning an arms deal in the 1990s.
He has already pleaded not guilty to 16 counts of racketeering, corruption, fraud, tax evasion and money laundering.
NPA spokesperson Mthunzi Mhaga said they would comment once there was a pronouncement from the judge hearing the matter.
Lusanda Ntuli of the office of the Chief Justice Mogoeng Mogoeng said that the judiciary had not received an application.

headline: 12 Soldiers Killed in Burkina Faso Attack: SABC
summarized_story:
At least 12 soldiers were killed in an attack in northwestern Burkina Faso on Sunday and seven others are missing, SABC reports quoting security sources.
SABC says there has been no immediate comment from the army but quoted sources to have said the incident took place in the Toeni commune in the Boucle du Mouhoun region near the border with Mali.
According to the Communications Ministry, a special army unit killed two prominent jihadists in the same region.
Attacks by militants linked to al Qaeda and Islamic State are on the rise in West Africa’s Sahel region, killing thousands and displacing millions in recent years across Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger.
On Wednesday, an armed group killed 30 civilians, army soldiers and pro-government militiamen in a series of attacks near Burkina Faso’s border with Niger.

headline: Trending: Outcry Over Demolition Of Property in Imo State
summarized_story:
Chidi Akpunku, a native of Imo State, South east Nigeria has lamented the demolition of his property worth hundreds of millions of Naira alleged to be illegally carried out by the Imo State Government recently.
In another development, grief, anger and sorrow where the expressions on the faces of UTC traders in the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja, who expressed fear over an attempt to take over their business areas.
A woman perceived to be a mother of a student of University of Nigeria, Nsukka has decried the poor living condition in which students in a yet to be identified hostel in the school are subjected to.
Reactions continue to trail wedding ceremony between Yusuf son of President, Muhammadu Buhari and daughter of the Emir of Bichi, Nasir Ado-Bayero.
